newsitem.title: USA: Jason motor vehicle, industrial segments gain.
newsitem.headline: Jason motor vehicle, industrial segments gain.

text.p: Jason Inc said Tuesday a rise in its third quarter earnings was due to strong performance in both its motor vehicle and industrial segments.
It reported earnings for the third quarter of $0.11 a share, up from $0.07 a year earlier.

Jason said motor vehicle segment sales and earnings rose due to a seven percent increase in U.S. automotive production during the quarter, as well as increased sales of its new Marabond moldable fiber insulation.
Jason said its Milsco Manufacturing unit, which supplies seats and accessories to Harley-Davidson Inc, also contributed strongly to results in this segment.
Jason said its industrial products divisions all had strong performances in the quarter, reflecting a healthy U.S. economy and good operating control.
Results in the power generation segment declined due to continuing softness in the U.S. market and pricing pressure on foreign jobs, it said.
Jason said it did not expect the power generation market to improve for several quarters.
The company said its previously announced acquisition of a 51 percent stake in Suroflex GmbH, a German automotive insulation maker, is expected to close by the end of October.
Jason said the response from European automotive manufacturers to its planned purchase of a majority stake in Suroflex had been "extremely positive."
